intro: Senecio clivicola var. pampae, commonly known as the Pampas senecio, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in the grasslands of Argentina and Uruguay. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. This variant is distinguished by its slender, upright stems and small, yellowish to greenish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and is adapted to temperate climates with seasonal rainfall. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
